title: Check if Array is Sorted
description:
IS_SORTED checks whether any array of REAL is sorted in
ascending order. When called, a pointer to the array and its size in bytes is
transferred to the function. Under CoDeSys the call is:
_ARRAY_SORT(ADR(Array), SIZEOF(Array)), where array is the name of the
array to be manipulated. ADR() is a standard function which identifes the
pointer to the array and SIZEOF() is a standard function, which determines
the size of the array.
The function returns TRUE if the array is sorted in ascending order.
This type of processing arrays is very efcient because no additional meï¿¾mory is required and no surrender values must be copied.
name: IS_SORTED

input.name: pt
input.description: A pointer to an array containing REAL numbers.

input.name: size
input.description: The size of the array, specifying the number of elements in the pointer array.

return_value.description: Returns TRUE if the array is sorted in ascending order, otherwise returns FALSE.
